Steps to Execute: 1. Initialize ikea_outlet_mock with mock hub and hub outlet.
Expected Results: Outlet should initialize with name "Mock Outlet 1" and unique ID "O1907151129080101_1".
Outlet is_on property should be True after calling turn_on.

Steps to Execute: 1. Initialize ikea_outlet_mock. 2. Call turn_on method. 3. Call turn_off method.
Expected Results: Outlet is_on property should be False after calling turn_off.

Scenario Description: Verify unique ID generation for multiple outlets
Expected Results: Each outlet should have a unique ID with incremented counter.

Scenario Description: Verify outlet name generation for multiple outlets
Expected Results: Each outlet should have a unique name with incremented counter.
Outlet should have manufacturer "IKEA of Sweden".
Outlet should have software version "mock sw".

Scenario Description: Verify outlet initial state is off
Expected Results: Outlet is_on property should be False initially.

Scenario Description: Verify outlet state persistence after turning on and off
Steps to Execute: 1. Initialize ikea_outlet_mock. 2. Call turn_on method. 3. Call turn_off method.
Expected Results: Outlet should correctly reflect state changes in is_on property.

Scenario Description: Verify outlet state does not change without turn_on or turn_off calls
Steps to Execute: 1. Initialize ikea_outlet_mock. 2. Do not call turn_on or turn_off.
Expected Results: Outlet is_on property should remain False.

Scenario Description: Verify outlet state change with multiple turn_on calls
Steps to Execute: 1. Initialize ikea_outlet_mock. 2. Call turn_on method multiple times.
Expected Results: Outlet is_on property should be True regardless of multiple turn_on calls.

Scenario Description: Verify outlet state change with multiple turn_off calls
Steps to Execute: 1. Initialize ikea_outlet_mock. 2. Call turn_off method multiple times.
Expected Results: Outlet is_on property should be False regardless of multiple turn_off calls.

Scenario Description: Verify outlet state change with interleaved turn_on and turn_off calls
Steps to Execute: 1. Initialize ikea_outlet_mock. 2. Call turn_on and turn_off methods in sequence.
Expected Results: Outlet is_on property should reflect the last method called.

Steps to Execute: 1. Initialize ikea_outlet_mock. 2. Call turn_on method. 3. Re-initialize ikea_outlet_mock.
Expected Results: Outlet is_on property should reset to False after re-initialization.
